numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph illustrates responses of 15-24-year-olds and 40-year-olds from different countries.
2. A person asked these people a question.
3. The question is: Is the world getting better with each generation?
4. The group of 15-24-year-olds is more optimistic than the group of 40-year-olds.
5. The group of 15-24-year-olds is more hopeful than the group of 40-year-olds.
6. Some countries are optimistic for the future.
7. The wealth of each optimistic country is equally spread out among the optimistic countries.
8. I wonder why the difference in optimism between the age groups is distinct.
9. This graph relates to me and my community.
10. Today, people often say that my generation needs to start making changes.
12. People say that these changes are necessary for hope for our future.
13. A possible title for this graph is: The youth is hopeful for the future of the world.
